intro: Centaurea acicularis, commonly known as the needlecentaurea, is a flowering plant species native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its slender, needle-like leaves and produces small, spiky yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in steppe and grassland habitats. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Centaurea acicularis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
